text: John II Casimir Vasa (; ; 22 March 1609 – 16 December 1672) was King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania from 1648 to his abdication in 1668 as well as a claimant to the throne of Sweden from 1648 to 1660. He was the first son of Sigismund III Vasa with his second wife Constance of Austria. John Casimir succeeded his older half-brother, Władysław IV Vasa. ==References== Category:1609 births Category:1672 deaths Category:Kings of Poland Category:Grand Dukes of Lithuania
title: John II Casimir Vasa
